intro: Lasiandra trichopoda, commonly known as the roughleaf lasiandra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Lasiandra trichopoda is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to dry and nutrient-poor conditions.
